decreased working all the way around at the end of the round next round knit all stitches will be knit and you will have 126 156 repeat these last 2 rounds 14 times total stitches on your circular needle with none remaining switching to dpns when the stitches become too on your dpns tight on circulars until 10 12 stitches remain on your needles cut your yarn leaving a long tail and using a main fabric tapestry needle thread the yarn through the increase round for size small with mc k5 m1 remaining live stitches cinch the top closed and 24 times until 6 stitches remain knit to end 24 weave in the ends stitches increased 150 stitches on needles increase round for size large with mc k6 m1 k7 m1 repeat 12 times to end of row 24 stitches increased 180 stitches on needles both sizes resume round 1 knit to end placing markers every 30 stitches make sure your chart markers are a different color or style from your main marker so you know where your round begins round 2 begin following color chart a b working the chart a total of 5 6 times per round read the chart from right to left bottom to top so the text appears correctly 06 the resist hat finishing your notes to block fill up a basin or large bowl with cold water and a splash of wool soap slowly immerse your hat in the water until it is completely saturated letting it soak for 30 minutes or more carefully drain the basin and press the water out of the tank being careful not to twist or agitate your hat to avoid felting lay a bath towel on the ground with your hat on top then roll it up in the towel burrito-style press on the rolled towel to extract additional water from the tank unroll the towel and lay your hat flat undisturbed for 1-2 days until completely dry if you would like to add a pom pom take a small rectangle of cardboard about the size of your hand first lay a piece of yarn lengthwise on top of the cardboard this will be used to cinch your pom pom together in the middle next start wrapping your yarn perpendicular to the piece of yarn you laid down around and around the cardboard until it s thick use that first piece of yarn to tie up the yarns together and tie a tight knot lastly remove the cardboard from inside your yarn bundle and snip your yarn bundle across the loops on each side until you have a bunch of fringe fluff your pom pom and trim all the pieces of yarn to the same length
